definitions.definition: To determine the weight of an object.
Often with "out", to measure a certain amount of something by its weight, e.g. for sale.
definitions.example: He weighed out two kilos of oranges for a client.

definitions.definition: To determine the intrinsic value or merit of an object, to evaluate.
definitions.example: You have been weighed in the balance and found wanting.
I weigh ten and a half stone.

definitions.definition: To have weight; to be heavy; to press down.
To be considered as important; to have weight in the intellectual balance.
To raise an anchor free of the seabed.
To bear up; to raise; to lift into the air; to swing up.
To consider as worthy of notice; to regard.
